intro: Melandrium nyalamense, commonly known as the Nyalam catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its erect stems, lance-shaped leaves, and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
